comment.body:
Interesting to point out:
> By law, NSLs can request only non-content information, for example, transactional records and phone numbers dialed, but never the content of telephone calls or e-mails.

[Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=National_security_letter&oldid=697706704#cite_note-crs-2)

I wonder what kinds of data could be included then. Private messages would be considered mail I think. IP addresses might be what they were looking for. Of course, this is assuming the law was followed, though I think reddit would have challenged the order otherwise.
